concillium.additionalInfo: Please specify additional questions that you would like to discuss during consultation.

concillium.description1: A comprehensive consultation, to which we will invite those specialists that you need, is an opportunity to quickly get a common opinion and develop an action plan for the near future. Rarus Health will help you prepare for the consultation so that you get answers to all your questions.
concillium.description2: To develop a life trajectory for patients with rare diseases, the opinion of several specialists is always needed: a pediatrician, a neurologist, an endocrinologist, a geneticist, a rehabilitation therapist, a speech therapist, a nutritionist, etc. Visiting each of them separately requires large resources, while it is difficult to form a single picture from their conclusions, and sometimes they contradict each other.
concillium.diseasesDuringPregnancy: List infectious diseases and injuries during pregnancy
concillium.documentsSubtitle: Please upload all the documents that you would like to show at the consultation
concillium.faq: We have compiled a list of frequently asked questions. Please mark those that you also care about.
concillium.faqBackHurts: 10. I'm tired of the child, my back hurts, etc.
concillium.faqGeneticTestMean: 1. What does the genetic test result mean?
concillium.faqGoodActivities: 7. What activities (sports, educational) will have a positive impact on the life and development of my child?
concillium.faqHealthyBaby: 8. We plan to have more children. How do we give birth to a healthy baby?
concillium.faqHelpCenters: 9. Are there any help centers for people like us?
concillium.faqIntellectualDevelopment: 5. What peculiarities of intellectual development should we expect?
concillium.faqNormalSchool: 6. Will my child be able to go to a “normal” kindergarten or school?
concillium.faqParentsNeedsTest: 3. Do my parents need to take a genetic test and if so - which one?
concillium.faqPrognosis: 4. What is the prognosis for the condition: how will it develop?
concillium.faqResultsNeedsConfirmation: 2. Do these results need to be confirmed using another research method?
concillium.fatherage: Age at the time of pregnancy
concillium.forgottenActions: List here, what your child has learned first and then as if forgot how to do it
concillium.forgottenActionsExample: For example, stopped smiling, sitting, standing
concillium.growthRetatdation: Did the doctor diagnose "intrauterine growth retatdation"
concillium.holdingHeadAge: At what age did your child start holding your head
concillium.medicationDuringPregnancy: What medications (other than vitamins) did your mother take during pregnancy
concillium.monosylabicAge: At what age did your child start pronouncing monosyllabic words (ba-ma-du)
concillium.motherage: At what age did the pregnancy occur
concillium.oftenColds: My child often suffers from colds
concillium.pregnancySubitle: Please fill the information about the pregnancy and childbirth
concillium.preparationSubitle: Please specify what you would like to discuss during consultation
concillium.scooterOrClimbingAge: At what age did your child master a scooter and start climbing stairs without help
concillium.sentencesAge: At what age did your child start speaking two-word sentences ("Mom, give")
concillium.sittingAge: At what age did your child start sitting on your own
concillium.standingAge: At what age did your child start standing on your own

documents.whatIsShareDocuments: Sharing a document with your doctor is a convenient feature that allows you to securely share important medical information with your healthcare provider. This can include medical records, test results, and other health-related documents that may be relevant to your care. By sharing these documents, your doctor can gain a better understanding of your health history and make more informed decisions about your treatment.

patientHome.ricarteSotoParagraph1:
Ricarte Soto Law is a Financial Protection System for Diagnosis and High Cost Treatments. 

 It has universal coverage, all users of the Isapres, Fonasa and Armed Forces health insurance systems can make use of this benefit. 
 
 We invite you to learn how to activate these benefits, if you have any of these diseases: 

 1. Mucopolysaccharidosis type I 
 2. Mucopolysaccharidosis type II 
 3. Mucopolysaccharidosis type VI 
 4. Tyrosinemia type I 
 5. Gaucher disease 
 6. Fabry disease 
 7. Hereditary angioedema 
 8. Epidermolysis bullosa 
 9. Primary immunodeficiency 
 10. Huntington's disease 
 
 More information at www.supersalud. gob.cl
patientHome.ricarteSotoParagraph2:
It covers 100% of the value of high-cost medicines, medical devices or food, which are expressly guaranteed for each health problem defined in this law. 

 For some of these health problems, it guarantees coverage of the diagnostic test or specific high-cost tests that allow confirming the disease.
patientHome.ricarteSotoParagraph3:
Step 1 

 The pathology must be considered in the law and the medical specialist must be registered in the computer platform of this law. 

 Step 2 

 The treating specialist will nominate their patient through the form available on the FONASA electronic platform. 

 Step 3 

 The specialist will receive a response from the Committee of Clinical Experts of the approved Provider or the confirming Center. If it is positive, you can activate the benefits of the law for your patient.
patientHome.ricarteSotoTitle1: Do you know details of the Ricarte Soto Law?
patientHome.ricarteSotoTitle3: How do I access the benefits?

event.course0207Title: Course: Rare or Orphan Diseases in Nurses' Daily Work
event.webinar0603Title: Webinar: How to accelerate drug research for rare diseases
event.webinar1007Title: Webinar: The Registry for patients with genetic diseases rare and specialized
event.course0207Text:
Date and time:
	The webinar will take place on April 30th at 4:00 PM (GMT-4, CET-4) on Zoom. 
	Participation in the webinar is free. 
	Register now on the Rarus Health Digital Platform (clickable link) to secure your spot.

In honor of the coming Neurofibromatosis Awareness Day we are happy to announce the first Webinar for caregivers and patients living with NF-1 . 
In Rarus Health we love to answer patients' questions! We know how many difficulties patients with rare diseases face, how many questions they have day by day and how many things they need to google to find the ways to adapt their life for living with the diagnosis. But we also know that Dr Google is not always a trustworthy source of information!
This is why we have organized Rarus Health Academy - a section of our digital platform, where we conduct educational events that are requested by the patients. We are proud to share only curated information, which is based on international clinical guidelines and prepared together with scientists and medical professionals! 
We will discuss the following topics:
	Genetic tests to get the right diagnostics
	Red flags of “bad symptoms”: when you have to run to your doctor
	Annual check ups for kids and adults with NF
	Plexiform neurofibromas: the latest progress in the treatment
	Scientific progress in NF: on-going clinical trials 
Who is the webinar for?
	The webinar is aimed at patients with NF1 and their caregivers. It will be especially useful for newly diagnosed patients or the ones that would like to know more about their diagnosis and last achievements in the treatment.

About the speakers:
	Elmira Safarova, PhD in Molecular Biology and Pharmacology, CEO of Rarus Health SpA, 20+ years of experience in the Life Science industry, expert in R&D of new drugs. Innovation Reviewer for National Academy of Medicine (US) Catalyst Awards'23. Guest lecturer of the Moscow State University (2021-2022).
	Fernanda Pérez, Medical Lead, LATAM, Rarus Health SpA. Enfermera Universidad de Valparaíso. Experto Universitario en Genética Médica y Genómica. Universidad Católica de Murcia. Máster en Alta Dirección y MBA en Gerencias de Servicios de Salud.  Universidad Complutense de Madrid - CEREM. Máster © Economía de la salud y del fármaco. Universidad Pompeu Fabra. Barcelona. Máster en Big Data y Business Intelligence. Escuela de Negocios Europea de Barcelona, Universidad Isabel. Paciente con enfermedad rara 
	Alejandro Andrade, Head of FECHE
The webinar is organized by Rarus Health SPA, NF patient community (Chile)  and FECHER.

Rarus Health is a digital platform which supports patients with Rare Diseases, their caregivers and doctors. 
It makes patients’ lives easier by safely storing their medical documents online, helping in preparation for doctor’s and geneticist’s appointments, supporting them with the latest news about clinical trials and other curated information about the disease.
FECHER is Federación Chilena de Enfermedades Raras is a patient organization represents patients’ voice and understand needs of patients and caregivers in Chile.

event.webinar1007Text:
On July 10 at 18:00, Rarus Health will organize a webinar on registration for patients with rare genetic diseases and doctors. Fernanda Pérez will tell us why it is important to have a registry for rare diseases and how patients can influence its creation.

We will discuss the following topics:

How the registry helps access treatments that are not yet on the market or not available in a specific country.
How the registry helps the patient community gain free access to treatment and have arguments to negotiate with the government.
How the registry helps patients gather information about the possible development of the disease and the impact of treatment.
How doctors can participate in the creation and maintenance of the registry and what advantages it entails.
Available solutions for registries and what Rarus Health offers.
Who is the webinar for?

The webinar is aimed at patients with rare genetic diseases, their parents and legal guardians, doctors, and nurses. No matter how much you know about the disease or medical terms at this time, what matters is having the desire to understand and be willing to obtain better access to modern treatments.

The webinar is organized by Rarus Health. Rarus Health is a service that helps bring together all the necessary specialists and create a diagnostic or treatment plan for families with children with special needs, no matter where they are.

Date and time:

The webinar will take place on July 10 at in Zoom. Participation in the webinar is free.
event.webinar0603Text:
Rarus Health SPA and FECHER will host a special webinar for patients, caregivers, and healthcare specialists. In simple terms, we will explain a complicated concept of the drug research and development process and how it could be influenced by you.

Date and time:

March 6th at 6:30 p.m. (GMT-3/CET-4) on Zoom.
Participation in the webinar is free. Register now to secure your spot in the webinar here: https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLScXpEdZ8kMPSilefOZFrh5tdDMX5Z2KRZ3V-zVx4W6NmIlQ0A/viewform.

We will discuss the following topics:

How are drugs for rare diseases developed and made available for treatment?
Who decides which specific diseases receive attention for drug development?
The research and development process in the pharmaceutical industry. How is it planned and implemented?
How do patients, caregivers, and doctors have the power to influence this process?
Real examples, tools, and practices to make an impact.

Who is the webinar for?

The webinar is aimed at patients with rare genetic diseases, their caregivers, and healthcare specialists. No matter how much you know about the disease, medical terms, or drug development at this time. What matters is having the desire to understand the process and being willing to make an impact on the development of novel treatments and getting faster access to them.

About the speakers:

Dr. Elmira Safarova, Molecular Biology and Pharmacology, with over 20 years of experience in the Life Sciences industry, an expert in R&D of new drugs. Innovation Reviewer for the Catalyst Awards '23 from the National Academy of Medicine (USA). Guest lecturer at Moscow State University (2021-2022). Founder of Rarus Health SPA.
Fernanda Pérez, Nurse from the University of Valparaíso. University Expert in Medical Genetics and Genomics from the Catholic University of Murcia. Master's in Senior Management and MBA in Health Services Management from the Complutense University of Madrid - CEREM. Master's in Health and Drug Economics from Pompeu Fabra University, Barcelona. Master's in Big Data and Business Intelligence from the European Business School of Barcelona, Isabel University. Patient with a rare disease. Medical Lead, LATAM, Rarus Health, and Scientific Advisor of FECHER.

The webinar is organized by Rarus Health SPA and FECHER.

Rarus Health SPA is a digital platform that supports patients with rare diseases, their caregivers, and doctors in Latin America. It makes patients' lives easier by securely storing their medical documents online, helping in preparation for medical and genetic appointments, and supporting them with the latest news about clinical trials and other selected information about the disease.

FECHER is the Chilean Federation of Rare Diseases, a patient organization that represents the voice of patients and understands the needs of patients and caregivers in Chile.

You can read more about this event at the following link: https://www.rarediseaseday.org/event/charla-virtual-como-acelerar-la-investigacion-de-medicamentos-para-enfermedades-raras/

careManager.considerConsulting: Consider consulting your personal care manager if you:
careManager.item1: Don't comprehend the terminology in your genetic test results
careManager.item2: Seek scientific evidence-based answers regarding your disease
careManager.item3: Desire information on new drugs and clinical trials for your diagnosis
careManager.youCanChoose3: who will carefully examine your medical information and questions, draw up a clear personal care plan and provide support over the next three months
careManager.elmira1: PhD in Molecular Biology and Pharmacology
careManager.elmira2: Founder and scientific leader of Rarus Health SpA
careManager.elmira3: More than 25 years of experience in scientific drug development
careManager.elmira4: Language of consultation: English (preferably), Spanish and Russian
careManager.fernanda1: Leader of the medical area for LATAM
careManager.fernanda2: Professional nurse with specialisation in neuromuscular pathologies, pain and clinical genetics
careManager.fernanda3: University lecturer in various health schools
careManager.fernanda4: Leader of the academic area of the FECHER
careManager.stagesOfCare: Stages of the care manager's service
careManager.popupItem1-3: personal care manager will focus on your case to:
careManager.popupItem2: study all medical information provided by you
careManager.popupItem3: research international practice and find doctors, who treat such patients
careManager.popupItem4: check international database of clinical trials to inform you about them
careManager.popupItem5-3: to schedule a consultation time and discuss payment.
